channel.title: Anthology on Aaron Machuca
channel.description: Recent content in Anthology on Aaron Machuca

item.title: New Prescription
item.description: plucking my feathers licking my wounds what am I to take when I don’t want to eat anymore?

item.title: Psalm for the Self
item.description: My life wears a sarong sash of Van Gogh greens & mythic tapestries, of the Earth’s water-blood & soil-skin, dawned of the frost father, Ymir, in his dismembered image. I struggle — to jot tempest movements in a moment, when my marionette muscles strain in age; but I would write still, on broken fingers, even if a humble life would allow me to tenant in Elysium and crown a hero-halo over my brow, I would torch my ghost in ghastly flames, stirred in my scorn to live now, even if in this life the Lord’s trumpeters would not bless me with silver-gleamed wisdom.
